episode_name: 36 Parshas Shemos: No brain no gain
episode_description: Parshas Shemos: No brain no gain Hashem rewards the midwives with ‘houses’, yet not a house of Torah, why not? Is Torah not the most important thing in the world? Would that not have been a perfect reward for the self-sacrifice? How much are we focused on Torah & Yiras Shamayim as opposed to our own pleasures of this world? Is there something wrong with learning Gemora on the beach with a Piña colada? What is the fifth Chelek of the Shulchan Aruch? All this and more, be sure to subscribe to the podcast and send the links to your friends and family. www.prismoftorah.com

episode_name: Parshas Shemos -  Little Things Count
episode_description: Why does the Torah refer to Yocheved and Miriam by the nicknames "Shifra" and "Puah"? What deeper meaning lies behind these Names chosen to immortalize the righteous midwives? Listen in as we probe the mystery behind Hashem rewarding these selfless women with "houses" of Kehuna, Leviya, and Malchus. Join us on this week's journey through Parshat Shemot to discover how even the smallest acts of kindness - going beyond the call of duty to care for and beautify each Jewish newborn - reflect one's true spiritual greatness. What powerful lessons can we learn from Yocheved and Miriam's sensitivity to not just save Jewish babies, but lovingly tend to each one's needs?Tune into this soul-stirring episode now to unpack timeless messages on the profound impact even little things make when done with care, compassion and fear of Hashem.www.prismoftorah.org Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episode_name: Parshas Shemos - Emunah & Bitachon
episode_description: We put our trust in leaders, plans, and strategies, expecting our relief lies therein. Yet when new tyrants arise and old plans fail, where do we place our hopes? What is the impetus to finally cry out in earnest prayer? As Bnei Yisrael discovers in this episode, it is only when all else fails that we truly turn to Hashem. But what does this teach us about emunah and bitachon? Keywords: emunah, bitachon, prayer, leaders, plans, strategies, hopes, trust www.prismoftorah.org Hosted on Acast. episode_name: Parshas Shemos: The True Secret Weapon

Chazal enlighten us that the future redemption will resemble the redemption from Mitzrayim, happening swiftly too.   These insights hold relevance during these times. What is key to ensuring our prayers are heard by Hashem? What is the significance of "The gates of tears have not been locked"? Have you experienced ineffective prayers? episode_name: Parshas Vaera - Gaining by Giving
episode_description: What defines true greatness in Jewish leadership? When Moshe Rabbeinu was chosen to lead Klal Yisroel out of Mitzrayim, he possessed a unique quality that set him apart - but it wasn't his wisdom, his lineage, or even his humility. Through a fascinating analysis of why the Torah tells us twice that "Moshe grew up," we uncover a profound insight about the real meaning of being a gadol. From the shepherding of our greatest leaders to the open hands of those we lay to rest, this episode reveals an extraordinary perspective on what it truly means to be a big person. Discover how the seeming paradox of self-preservation and loving others as yourself contains the key to unlocking your highest potential. Join us as we explore how the path to genuine spiritual wealth might be hidden in the very act of giving itself.

episode_name: Parshas Vaera - Having The Right Perspective
episode_description: When is “bad” actually good? Why was Moshe criticized for defending Bnei Yisrael? What did the Avos endure without complaint? What key insight reshapes it all? episode_name: Parshas Vaera: Decoding the 10 Plagues
episode_description: Why did Hashem need 10 plagues—wouldn’t one catastrophic plague have sufficed? What is the deeper meaning behind the 3 distinct sets of plagues we see in the Hagadah? And why does the Torah spend so much time on the details of each plague?  This week's parsha raises profound questions about the nature of emunah, the path to personal growth, and Hashem’s relationship with humanity. By exploring insights on the makkos, this podcast reveals timeless lessons about strengthening your emunah amidst life's plagues and passions. You'll discover how the structure of the 10 plagues contains eternal truths about the journey from impurity to purity, mind to heart to action. A great Mashal & Story is given as well to emphasize the concept.

episode_name: 38: Parshas Bo - Proud to be a Jew

episode_name: Parshas Bo - To Do What is Really Right
episode_description: Intriguing questions arise as we prepare for the Exodus from Egypt. Why does Hashem command Bnei Yisrael to take the clothing of Mitzrayim when retaining our distinct dress was a key merit for redemption? Is there truly an issue with wearing their garb or only with the motivation behind doing so? Could acts be permissible by law yet still miss the spirit? As we strive to follow Halacha, must we also ensure meeting its ethos? Discover penetrating insights on this and more in our latest episode - delving into a fascinating kasha from Rav Zev on the perplexing directive to extract the raiment of our oppressors. episode_name: Parshas Bo - When Actions Speak Louder than Rules
episode_description: Parshas Bo When Actions Speak Louder than Rules How could Hashem ask the Jews to take Egyptian clothing when maintaining distinct Jewish dress was one of the key merits for redemption? What does this fascinating paradox teach us about the true meaning of Jewish identity? In this week's Parshas Bo, we uncover a profound insight that challenges our understanding of what it means to live an authentic Jewish life.  Join us for an eye-opening exploration of how the clothes we wear, the music we listen to, and the choices we make shape not just our external appearance, but the very essence of our connection to Hashem. This episode reveals concepts that will transform how you view the subtle interplay between halacha and the spirit of Yiddishkeit.

episode_name: Parshas Bo: Be All That You Can Be
episode_description: What did Moshe and Aaron represent that made them true equals, despite Aaron being Moshe's student? Why place Aaron's name before Moshe's? This episode explores their deeper bond that unified opposites into a greater whole - like two legs enabling one to walk. We’ll unpack three compelling resolutions for Rashi's perplexing statement that they shared the same exalted rank, each teaching a pivotal lens for viewing Judaism. Discover anew how to appraise greatness, find meaning in supporting roles, and build bridges between contrasting paths that ultimately unite. Packed with metaphors and the Netziv’s mashul, let this podcast lead you to look beyond surface comparisons, embrace your distinctive purpose, and sanctify this world as one.

episode_name: Parshas Beshalach - Faith Can Move Mountains
episode_description: Why did Hashem tell Moshe it was not the time to pray, when prayer is our greatest weapon, especially during a time of crisis? How could Bnei Yisrael reach spiritual heights so quickly after the extreme impurity they endured in Egypt? What secret causes prophecy to dwell upon us? This week we will explore the story of how the splitting of the sea occurred and how it led Bnei Yisrael to reach great heights of prophecy through their unwavering faith. We will learn about the incredible power of elevating physicality through action and the vital practical lesson we can all learn from this Parsha. A story reveals how bitachon can change one's fate.

episode_name: 39 Parshas Yisro Taking the first step

episode_name: Parshas Yisro - Act Now or Stay Behind Forever
episode_description: What compelled Yisro to join Klal Yisrael after hearing about both Kriyas Yam Suf and Milchemes Amalek? Why does this seemingly simple combination of events hold such profound significance? In this week's episode, we unlock a fascinating insight from the Zohar about the art of truly seeing and responding to life-changing moments. While countless nations witnessed the same miracles, only Yisro's response earned him an eternal place in Torah. Through contemporary examples and two powerful stories, we discover the secret of Yisro. Learn the secret of why some people experience profound growth while others let transformative moments slip away, and discover how to harness this wisdom in today's extraordinary times.

episode_name: Parshas Mishpatim - Listen, Drink & Be Merry
episode_description: Why is the ear pierced for a slave who refuses freedom? Why is the ear chosen over the hand or foot? What makes Naaseh Vnishmah - 'hearing and listening' - so unique? Why is it crucial to accept the yoke of heaven by 'listening' to Hashem? In this week's parsha, we delve into a perplexing halacha regarding the ear of the eved ivri. By exploring its deeper significance, we uncover the secrets of the spiritual realms. The result is a formula for truly serving Hashem through cultivating faithful obedience. Join us on a thought-provoking journey into the essence of genuine Avodas Hashem. Additionally, a very interesting true story will be shared to illustrate the concept.   Always on www.prismoftorah.org    Keywords:  Parshat Mishpatim, eved ivri, pierced ear, Shema Yisrael, blind faith, slave/servant to Hashem, Purim drunkenness, observing Shemitah

episode_name: Parshas Mishpatim - The Heart of Hearing
episode_description: At Har Sinai, our ears heard every mitzvah - Shabbos, Kashrus, and the laws of proper speech. So why does only the Eved Ivri get his ear pierced for not listening? What makes this mitzvah so unique that it demands this powerful symbolic punishment? And what profound message lies in the fact that our ears are uniquely designed for receiving, unlike all our other senses? In this fascinating exploration of Parshas Mishpatim, we uncover the deep connection between listening and spiritual balance. Through a gripping story of a Manhattan accountant whose expertise becomes his greatest challenge, we discover how true wisdom often means knowing when to set aside our own understanding. Join us for an eye-opening journey into the art of spiritual listening, the power of genuine humility, and the delicate balance between human wisdom and Divine guidance. This episode reveals how recalibrating our spiritual ears might be the key to unlocking life's most profound transformations.

episode_name: Parshas Mishpatim - The Way To Do Chessed
episode_description: How can we maximize the impact of our mitzvos and chesed? We delve into the Torah's guidelines for lending money and uncover powerful insights. Why does Hashem focus on the details of how we give, not just the act itself? How do our intentions and efforts affect the quality of our mitzvos? Join us as we explore these thought-provoking questions and discover practical ways to infuse our spiritual actions with a full heart. Tune in now for an inspiring discussion that will elevate your avodas Hashem!Keywords: mitzvos, chesed, lending money, intentions, Hashemwww.prismoftorah.org Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episode_name: Parshas Mishpatim - What's Important in Life
episode_description: Ever wondered why the angels questioned giving the Torah to humanity? This week's episode of Prism of Torah dives into a fascinating new perspective from the Maggid Midrashna. We explore the concept of appreciating true value and how our actions speak louder than words. Rabbi Prisman unpacks the hidden message behind the angels' actions in Parashat Mishpatim, leaving us to ponder: Do we truly appreciate the gift of the Torah in our daily lives? How can we ensure our priorities align with its sacred wisdom? Join Rabbi Prisman for an insightful discussion that will challenge your perspective and inspire you to live a life guided by Torah values.Keywords: Parashat Mishpatim, Angels and Torah, Torah Values, Aligning Prioritieswww.prismoftorah.org Hosted on Acast. episode_name: 41: Parshas Teruma - Giving is Getting
episode_description: When giving for the Mishkan, the leaders seem to make a massive offer of filling in any deficit, they are punished, and one of the letters of their name is taken away. What is the punishment? How did it affect them? When we give Tzedoka who is really supporting whom? Two stories to show this idea how we never really know the truth of what is holding us up!

episode_name: Parshas Terumah - Optical Illusion of Giving
episode_description: Deceived by giving? Is charity truly a one-way street? Rabbi Asaf Aaron Prisman unpacks the fascinating concept of Terumah and reveals the hidden reciprocity in our acts of generosity. Explore the deeper meaning behind the giving of the Nashem in the desert dwelling, and discover how the very word "Nassim" holds a powerful clue. What does it mean to be "taking" when we give to Hashem? Join this episode of Prism of Torah Podcast and uncover the optical illusion of giving!Keywords: Terumah, Charity, Giving, Nashem, Mishkanwww.prismoftorah.org Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episode_name: Parshas Terumah - Rejuvenate Your Yiddishkeit
episode_description: Parshas Terumah - Rejuvenate Your Yiddishkeit If the Kruvim symbolize our greatest Torah scholars, why were they fashioned with childlike faces instead of elderly, wise figures with flowing beards? And why does Midrash Rabbah compare Torah to both gold and silver when gold clearly holds superior value? This week, we uncover a profound paradox at the heart of authentic Torah learning that might transform your entire approach to Yiddishkeit. The Aron's design reveals a startling truth—that childlike wonder and openness, not just scholarly seriousness, forms the foundation of becoming a true Talmid Chacham. Through a personal encounter with Rav Chaim Kanievsky zt"l, we witness how even the greatest minds maintain their excitement for learning at every level, embracing both the golden depths and silver accessibility of Torah. Join us to discover the delicate balance between intellectual growth and spiritual simplicity that can breathe new life into your daily avodas Hashem.

episode_name: Parshas Terumah - Renovations for the Shechinah
episode_description: This week's Parsha dives deep into the construction of the Mishkan, but is it simply a dwelling place for Hashem? Rabbi Prisman explores the fascinating idea that the Mishkan is also intrinsically linked to the Torah. What does it mean to "take" Hashem into our midst? How can we create a space for both Hashem's presence and the study of Torah in our own lives? Join Rabbi Prisman as he unpacks the layers of meaning behind the commandment to build the Mishkan and reveals the profound connection between Torah, Hashem, and the Jewish people. Tune in to discover how this concept can impact your daily connection to Judaism!Keywords: Parshat Terumah, Mishkan, Torah study, Shechinahwww.prismoftorah.org Hosted on Acast. episode_name: Parshas Terumah - Supporting the Supporter
episode_description: In this thought-provoking episode of Prism of Torah, Rabbi Asaf Aaron Prisman delves into Parshas Terumah and the deeper meaning behind giving to the Mishkan. Rabbi Prisman explores these questions and more, drawing upon insights from the Rambam, Chofetz Chaim, and a powerful story about Rabbi Eliezer Gordon. episode_name: Parshas Tetzaveh - The Best Way to Live Life

episode_name: Parshas Tetzaveh - Which Lens Are You Using
episode_description: Why does the 'Meil Tchelet' (Turquoise coat) worn by the Kohen Gadol atone specifically for the sin of Lashon Hara? What deeper connection exists between the jingling bells at its hem and our everyday speech? Reb Asaf uncovers the hidden wisdom through this connection. Discover insights from Chazal about how the garments of the Kohanim carry profound messages for our modern lives. The symbolism of turquoise, the ocean's boundaries, and the surprising lesson of seeing the complete picture will transform how you view others and help you guard your speech. This isn't just about avoiding negative talk – it's about adopting a heavenly perspective that can bring true Shalom to your relationships and our world. Perhaps this can help you in one of life's most challenging but "very rewarding" mitzvos.

episode_name: Parshas Tetzaveh- Impact Your Destiny

This week, we delve into the mysteries surrounding the clothing of the Cohen. By closely examining the pessukim, we uncover valuable lessons on recognizing the hand of God and learn how the most profound Divine revelations are achieved. How much is drunk and why? All here this week.

episode_name: 43: Parshas Ki Sisa- The half time show

episode_name: Parshas Vayakhel - Golden Intentions
episode_description: Have you ever been asked to take something precious and give it away? This week's episode explores the deeper meaning behind the mitzvah of giving in Parshas Vayakhel. Discover how the giving of gold in the Mishkan wasn't just about the material, but about revealing the depths of our hearts. Tune in to unlock the secrets of true connection! episode_name: Parshas Vaykhel - Dream it, Do it With Hashem
episode_description: Have you ever wondered what enables ordinary people to achieve extraordinary things? How could the Bnei Yisroel, without specialized training or experience, create the intricate vessels for the Mishkan? What hidden force allows us to transcend our natural limitations when our hearts are fully engaged?In Parshas Vayakhel, we encounter a curious repetition. The Torah describes those who contributed to building the Mishkan as people "whose hearts lifted them up" and those "whose spirits moved them." This seemingly redundant phrasing caught the attention of commentators like the Ramban and Or HaChaim, who discovered profound implications about human potential hidden within these words.Join Reb Prisman as he unpacks the fascinating concept of "spiritual DNA" - the mysterious capacity for heart-driven determination to unlock capabilities we never knew we possessed. Through analysis of traditional sources and a remarkable modern story about a family who transformed a simple business decision into a global empire, we'll explore how this ancient wisdom continues to shape our understanding of human achievement.Check out our website prismoftorah.org

episode_name: 44: Parshas Vayakhel / Pekudei – start being a wise man
episode_description: www.prismoftorah.com The items have been brought to assist the Mishkan construction. Hashem says a חכם לב should build the Mishkan. What does the heart have to do with anything? In fact why is the brain, the power of thinking never mentioned in the Torah? Surely it should be the most important part of the person? Knowledge is knowing a tomato is a fruit; Wisdom is not putting it in a fruit salad We have to learn from this lesson how this message should be taken into real-life situations. A story that shows us how some are able to do it after the money jumps out from under the bed- yes it’s a true story All this and more on the podcast with Reb Asaf Aharon Prisman Techincal support questions: admin@prismoftorah.com

episode_name: 376: Parshas Pekudei - Mirror, Mirror on the Sink
episode_description: How can mirrors, so often symbols of vanity, transform into vessels of sanctity (Kedusha)? What profound lesson does the Kiyor teach us about the elevation of the mundane? In Parshas Pekudei, we explore these compelling questions and unravel the debate between Moshe Rabbeinu and Hashem over the purpose of physical pleasures in this world. Delve into the remarkable insights of Rav Shimshon Raphael Hirsch, uncovering how even the Yetzer Hara can be elevated into a tool for Avodas Hashem. This episode illustrates how we can infuse holiness into the very fabric of our daily lives. Tune in now for a profound journey into the heart of Kedusha and discover how to elevate the physical into the spiritual.
